text: Concept vraiment au top!!! On choisit notre "ice cream" de A à Z c'est vraiment cool!!

Yes. I do enjoy the yogurt but they make more than passable crepes too.  The secret to getting a reasonable value is to concentrate on the yogurt and skip the toppings and the syrups.  Its all good but they only way not to feel guilty here is to have 6 oz. or less of the yogurt and no toppings and syrup.  As with salad bars, it is not the lettuce that has the calories its the dressings and toppings.  Forget about parking downtown; you won't pay less than $3 & likely will pay as much as $6.

I enjoy Yeh's frozen yogurt and have been enjoying it regularly over the summer.  That said, their service was quite rude the last time I went, and brought friends. Some kid started busting my balls about not getting my own samples. Nevermind that I brought them two new customers.  I also find that they're lying back on their laurels. There's little in terms of product innovation going on, no new flavors, and regulars know that only one or two of they're flavors are any good. Nutella, honey Greek yogurt and Belgian chocolate. The rest are mediocre at best.  In a market where Menchie's has now moved in, the quality needs a serious boost in my opinion to justify the high prices.  And the sample policing needs to stop. Customers that bring you customers are your promoters, don't misbehave and turn us into detractors.  Yeh, there's work to be done.
Fruit flies everywhere. Dead ones on the counter. Gross! Yeh to the food, but no to cleaniness!

This is by far the worst and most overpriced frozen yogurt I have ever had. Tried two flavors and after finding them both appallingly disgusting (I have been to other froyo places in the US that I liked) felt obligated to buy something. So I got a mix of vanilla & cookies and cream. Absolutely disgusting. My boyfriend took a bite and spat it on the street. Also I grabbed one topping of a chocolate covered pretzel and it was so stale it was almost inedible. My cup was less than half full and it still weighed in at almost SIX DOLLARS.  Buyer bewwaaaaaree

Je suis vendue à Yeh, et maintenant que cette succursale a fait surface tout près de chez moi, je vous laisse imaginer les dommages que ça a causé à mon portefeuille et mes entraînements au gym: j'ai repris du bedon, ha!  Plus sérieusement, si vous n'êtes pas familier avec le concept, Yeh! c'est un bar à yogourt glacé. Une variété de saveurs, avec des étiquettes allant du sans sucre, faible en grand, sans lactose et sorbet, sont disposées sur le mur au fond du petit local. On prend un bol, on le remplit à sa guise (genre red velvet, keylime pie, sorbet à la fraise et chocolat noir #gouteràtoute), et hop! On se dirige au comptoir à garniture où là gros party, tout ce dont tu rêves est devant toi: cups de chocolat beurre de peanuts, des morceaux de oreo et de graham, des serpents en jujubes, des brownies, pâtes à biscuits, toutes les fruits dont t'as envie (oui oui même du dragonfruit), des boules de tapioca tellement chimique, du coulis de caramel et des sprinkles pour terminer le tout, parce que #sprinklesdonthavecalories. #likeificareafterthis15$icecreambowl #pauvre #heureuse

Ha, le paradis lors d'une chaude journée de shopping! Vous vous retrouvez avec un joli pot rose que vous pouvez remplir à votre guise de yogourt glacé grace à des stations libre-services . Puisque c'est au poids, et que j'aime bien goûter à tout sans manger des tonnes, mon gros fun c'est de me servir juste un peu de chaque saveur que je veux goûter. Ensuite vient la station des garnitures: Chocolats, bonbons, fruits séchés, noix, morceaux de brownies, vous avez l'embarras du choix. Puis vous pouvez même ajouter du coulis de caramel, fraise ou chocolat sur le dessus de votre oeuvre d'art. Puisque je reste habituellement raisonnable au niveau des garnitures (c'est ça qui est lourd sur la balance!), mon pot de yogourt glacé mixe pas-si-rempli-mais-juste-assez-pour-combler-mon-envie me coute entre 2,50$ et 3$. On parle d'un prix abordable! Ils font également des crêpes, du café (ben correct) et des biscuits selon le même concept de "choisissez ce que vous voulez dedans et on le cuit on the spot". Ils ont plusieurs locations sur l'île de Montréal, et les saveurs changent de succursales en succursales ainsi qu'au fil des saisons. Sympathique concept, j'adopte!

I love Yeh, but not all places have a cool ambiance and all working flavors. Great service and awesome staff! Will come back on a regular basis !  Expensive for froyo but I can't stay away from it. I wish they all carried litchi flavor and watermelon, my two favorite ones so far :)

Standard froyo scene, pick up a cup and go to town. Went there a few times and there wasn't much change in flavour selection. I was expecting exciting new changes to keep customers enticed. Also this location needs more seating!  Go light on the toppings, cause those will pile on weight. Trying not to spend too much is tough. They surprisingly have lots of other stuff like crepes and smoothies, I think more promo would let people see beyond the froyo bar.
Les yogourts ne sont pas très bon et il n'y a pas beaucoup de choix pour les garnitures. À quelques mètres de là, vous trouverez la boutique Blue Boy qui est 10 fois meilleure.

This frozen yogurt place is in Eaton Centre. It's serve yourself and your masterpiece gets weighed when you're checking out. I like any froyo place that offers fruity frozen yogurt flavors that aren't too "yogurty" tasting. Ironic, I know.   This place happens to have mango, strawberry and lychee which were all fantastic. They also offer 3 different size frozen yogurt cups which was great. This kept me from filling one of the bigger cups w too much froyo and toppings. It's all about moderation. :) I was definitely happy w my mid day frozen treat.

Inside the food court of Eaton center you will find this small shop with delicious frozen yogourt with different type of flavors. It is a self service you decide the flavor (s) of ice cream you like, than you can fill with toppings and believe me there are plenty of options candies, cookies, fruits and something that I don't know the name but it's a bubble that explode in your mouth when you eat it so fresh and good loll This place is great but be careful they charge you upon the weight so don't eat with your eyes :D

Yogurt was great!! Place could use a little extra cleaning up; although i assume it must be tough with kids dropping toppings but a little extra attention to detail on the floor and chairs would give them a perfect score!!

Yeh used to be better. The only flavour that's good now is their original, ironically. The service is generally friendly.  I find it expensive for what you get. Go sit somewhere that's not a chain on this street packed with great dessert options.
